And we also have half a dozen portable audiometers because obviously if you're doing speech work.
You have to a lot of the protocols require you to test hearing, but the other side of it of course, is that we have an audiology Masters program that runs here.
And so we're working on Inter interlinking with those with that Department.
And the Audiometers are part of that process as well.

We were fully with one small soundproof booth and.

For structure this is me.
In big letters.

So my background initially I've had several sort of reincarnations in terms of my career, and initially I started off doing field work and minority language documentation in the Pacific Northwest Coast in Canada.
So I worked on Haida Salish and Tlingit did a lot of field work on reservations and best quality recordings, which at the time meant going around with a cassette recorder and magnetic tapes.
And the very best microphone that I could find and recording in peoples homes and all that kind of stuff.

And then a lot of acoustic analysis and fed confirm logical analysis of the resulting material, so I carried it on nowadays in my Irish context, my Irish reincarnation in terms of working on Kent and Gammon, which is.
